Malone is a Professor of Information Technology and of Organizational Studies at the MIT Sloan School of Management, and his research focuses on how new organizations can be designed to take advantage of the possibilities provided by information technology.He has published his groundbreaking research in the book The Future of Work and in over 100 articles, research papers, and book chapters. November 1, 2016, Kevin was a client of George‚Äôs

George Polzer  is extremely sharp, resourceful and dedicated to the highest standards of professionalism. George provided me the necessary IT and mass communication systems that allowed for rapidly expanding and managing the client base and to effectively offer ongoing support in a very complex $2.1 billion dollar reorganization of a life-settlement portfolio. He showed great initiative in developing web-based solutions that assisted clients  in making critical ownership elections, using his state-of-the-art  visualization dashboards and break-even tools.  His business savvy and experience were also invaluable in navigating through the complexities of this 18 month reorganization involving Life Partners, Inc. . George is very easy to work with; grasp complex issues with nuance and combines these formidable skills  with this technical expertise in digitizing innovative business solutions that work and are extremely user-friendly. I highly recommend him for any tasks that require the above skill sets. Please advise should you need more detail.

George is a powerhouse who I believe would be a visionary, energetic, and smart addition to any business.

Shalom worked for me at my Internet sales and marketing consultancy company, RevealNet, for two years. He started at an entry-level position, but it wasn't long before I noticed that he had an exceptional combination of skills that could significantly help my company grow. With each promotion, Shalom proved himself skilled at learning whatever was required to do the job well, and more. He proved himself capable of shouldering as much responsibility as I gave to him. He has a sharp wit, a keen grasp of technology, and outstanding communication skills, which proved useful both in client relations and, ultimately, in managing my staff of 50 as General Manager. Any company would be fortunate to have the positive, creative powerhouse that Shalom is on their team.

summary: EXCELLENCE & MULTI-INDUSTRY DIVERSITY: Business Process Automation ‚ñ∫Digital Brand & Product Development ‚ñ∫IT Strategic Alliances ‚ñ∫ Minimum Viable Product Go-to-Market ‚ñ∫Demand Generation RAPID BUSINESS EXPANSION, ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE & MACHINE LEARNING ENABLER & PRODUCT MARKETING with expertise in business start-up, proof-of-concept, test selling & new product launch or re-positioning. High-tech, Legal Services, Real Estate & Financial Sector Focus. Advising senior management on low-cost start-up strategies; successfully scaling operation from one-man launch to fully staffed organization.Entrepreneurial management experience operating growth companies, developing & implementing business automation solutions, & defining best business practices. Expert at bootstrapping based on iterative phases doing what must be done to get to the next stage of success with minimal capitalStrategic thinker, exceptional problem solver with hands-on approach. Able to quickly assemble operational components at the right time to launch a business or establish a new unit in an existing operation+ Re-branded & positioned company - 25 yr. old ad agency - into digital age for new business development / rapid growth, launched new multi-channel marketing automation platform for new product positioning, executed partner marketing campaign, CRM enablement with 30k+ email database+ Launched & operated Bechtel's Artificial Intelligence Institute in London, UK+ Founded & grew an Internet company staffed with 55 employees and built the industry's first browser-based sales collaboration tool+ In the financial sector, built successful commercial real estate mortgage firm, broadened retirement investment company's alternative asset offerings and implemented new client acquisition strategiesTrack record in product development, brand building, and new market penetration. Managing growth companies and determine the critical path to launch overseas operations.
